cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move WNW across Hispaniola today, skirt or move over Cuba Sunday night–Monday, then turn northwest over the southeast Gulf of Mexico and approach the upper TX–SW LA coast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas–south-west Louisiana coast (near Port Arthur/Beaumont–Lake Charles area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – current watches confined to Hispaniola, Cuba, Bahamas and Florida Keys
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A – current warnings confined to Hispaniola, Cuba, Bahamas and Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from upper Texas through Louisiana and Mississippi is in the day-4/5 cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (34–50 kt probabilities up to 25%/9% respectively) mid-week
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge above 3 ft along the upper TX coast, including Sabine/Neches waterway near Beaumont
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 4–8 inches with localized higher totals, producing flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Embedded tornadoes in outer rain-bands and river/urban flooding could disrupt port operations
